Groups.Group: Red Hat Software Collections 1 for RHEL 6
Red Hat Software Collections 1 for RHEL 7

Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk devtoolset-6-dyninst
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: new packages: devtoolset-6-dyninst
Vulnerability.Description:
New devtoolset-6-dyninst packages are now available as a part of Red Hat Developer Toolset 6.0 for Red Hat Enterprise Linux. Dyninst is an Application Programming Interface (API) that permits the insertion of code into a running program, as well as changing or removing subroutine calls from application programs. Runtime code changes are useful for a variety of uses, including debugging, performance monitoring, and composing applications out of existing packages. The goal of Dyninst is to provide a machine-independent interface to permit the creation of tools and applications that use runtime code patching. The devtoolset-6-dyninst packages provide the Red Hat Developer Toolset version of Dyninst.
This enhancement update adds the devtoolset-6-dyninst packages to Red Hat Developer Toolset. (BZ#1351770)
For detailed changes, see the Red Hat Developer Toolset 6.0 User Guide linked from the References section.
All users who require devtoolset-6-dyninst are advised to install these new packages.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
